value.string:
"""
 Builds the delivery.
 """
 from Products.ERP5Type.Log import log
 delivery = sci['object']
 delivery_portal_type = delivery.getPortalType()
 portal_deliveries = sci.getPortal().portal_deliveries
 
 builder_by_ptype = {
 'Sale Invoice Transaction' : 'sale_invoice_transaction_builder',
 'Purchase Invoice Transaction' : 'purchase_invoice_transaction_builder',
 'Pay Sheet Transaction' : 'pay_sheet_transaction_builder',
 }
 
 if builder_by_ptype.has_key(delivery_portal_type) :
 builder = getattr(portal_deliveries, builder_by_ptype[delivery_portal_type], None)
 if builder is None :
 log('erp5_accounting',
 'unable to build : no builder in %s' % builder_by_ptype[delivery_portal_type])
 return
 
 ### Kev patch: Generate pay sheet accounting lines (inspired by order_workflow)
 # (It could be great to make this Delivery_build script more generic)
 if delivery_portal_type == 'Pay Sheet Transaction':
 PRIORITY = 3
 pay_sheet = delivery
 previous_tag = pay_sheet.getPath() + '_firstUpdateAppliedRule'
 expand_tag = pay_sheet.getPath() + '_expand'
 activate_kw = { 'tag' : expand_tag
 , 'priority': PRIORITY
 }
 
 pay_sheet.activate( tag = expand_tag
 , after_tag = previous_tag
 , priority = PRIORITY
 ).updateAppliedRule( rule_reference = 'default_invoice_rule'
 , activate_kw = activate_kw
 )
 
 builder = pay_sheet.portal_deliveries.pay_sheet_transaction_builder
 builder.activate( activity = 'SQLQueue'
 , after_tag = expand_tag
 , priority = PRIORITY
 ).build( explanation_uid = pay_sheet.getUid()
 , activate_kw = activate_kw
 )
 return
 ### End of kev patch
 
 
 # build accounting lines
 explanation_uid_list = [delivery.getUid(), ]
 packing_list = delivery.getCausalityValue(
 portal_type=('Sale Packing List',
 'Purchase Packing List'))
 if packing_list is not None:
 explanation_uid_list.append(packing_list.getUid())
 order = packing_list.getCausalityValue(
 portal_type=('Sale Order',
 'Purchase Order'))
 if order is not None:
 explanation_uid_list.append(order.getUid())
 
 build_trade_model_tag = 'invoice_transaction_build_trade_model_%s' % \
 delivery.getRelativeUrl()
 build_accounting_tag = 'invoice_transaction_build_accounting_%s' % delivery.getRelativeUrl()
 update_applied_rule_tag = '%s_updateAppliedRule' % delivery.getPath()
 builder.activate(
 activity='SQLQueue',
 after_tag=(update_applied_rule_tag,
 build_trade_model_tag,),
 tag=build_accounting_tag,
 activate_kw=dict(tag=build_accounting_tag)).build(
 activate_kw=dict(tag=build_accounting_tag),
 explanation_uid=explanation_uid_list)
 
 # build related payment transactions
 portal_deliveries.payment_transaction_builder.activate(
 activity='SQLQueue',
 after_tag=( build_trade_model_tag,
 update_applied_rule_tag,
 build_accounting_tag, ),
 ).build(
 explanation_uid=explanation_uid_list)
 
 # set the object in building state.
 delivery.startBuilding()
 delivery.activate(after_tag=(
 build_trade_model_tag,
 build_accounting_tag,)
 ).updateCausalityState()
